html body text table tbody tr td p font span
content: Greenhouse gas emissions are directly related to your car's fuel consumption, so choosing a fuel-efficient car and being responsible about how you use it will reduce its impact on the environment.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td p font font span span
content: If you're buying a new car, choose a fuel-efficient vehicle from the class of vehicle that best suits your needs ...

tag: html body text table tbody tr td ul li font font span span span
content: Consult the fuel consumption sticker displayed on new and used vehicles.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td ul li font font span span
content: Check and compare the car's environmental credentials using the federal government's

tag: html body text table tbody tr td p font font span em span span
html body text table tbody tr td p font font span em span a font span

html body text table tbody tr td p font span
html body text table tbody tr td ul li font span
content: Ensure your car is tuned and serviced regularly. The worst polluters on our roads tend to be old cars. If you do drive an older car, help the environment by making sure it is tuned according to the manufacturer's recommendations.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td ul li font span
content: Reduce your speed. Driving more slowly reduces fuel consumption. In fact, travelling at 110kph uses up to 25% more fuel than cruising at 90kph. For city driving, 60kph is the most fuel efficient speed.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td ul li font span
content: Drive smoothly. Avoid hard accelerating and heavy braking as it uses up a lot more fuel.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td ul li font span
content: Travel lightly and remove unnecessary items from your car to reduce weight - those golf clubs in the back and the surfboard on the roof create extra load and reduce aerodynamics. This will improve your fuel consumption and reduce emissions.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td ul li font span
content: Make sure your tyres are inflated to the correct pressure, as soft tyres cause higher fuel consumption.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td ul li font span
content: Filling up past the first click of the fuel nozzle means that fuel can be lost through the overflow pipe when you accelerate or go around corners.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td ul li font span
content: Consider how much you use your air conditioner - it can use up to 10% extra fuel.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td ul li font font span
content: Avoid peak-hour. If traffic is stationery, switch off the engine, even if you stop for a short time. Idling wastes fuel.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td ul li font span
content: Car-pool wherever possible, use public transport or ride a bicycle.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td ul li font span
content: Motorbikes and powered scooters are a very fuel-efficient form of transport, with reduced environmental impact.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td p font span
